Term.Name: precedes
Term.Definition: B precedes C if and only if B ends before C starts.

Term.Name: follows
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of precedes

Term.Name: meets
Term.Definition: B meets C if and only if B ends at the same time as C starts.

Term.Name: metBy
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of meets

Term.Name: overlaps
Term.Definition: B overlaps C if and only if B starts before C starts, B ends after C starts and B ends before C ends.

Term.Name: overlappedBy
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of overlaps

Term.Name: contains
Term.Definition: B contains C if and only if C starts after B starts and C ends at the same time as or before B ends, or C starts after or at the same time as B starts and C ends before B ends.

Term.Name: during
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of contains

Term.Name: strictContains
Term.Definition: B strictContains C if and only if C starts after B starts and C ends before B ends.

Term.Name: strictDuring
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of strictContains

Term.Name: starts
Term.Definition: B starts C if and only if B starts at the same time as C starts and B ends before C ends.

Term.Name: startedBy
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of starts

Term.Name: finishes
Term.Definition: B finishes C if and only if B starts after C starts and B ends at the same time as C ends.

Term.Name: finishedBy
Term.Definition: Inverse relation of finishes

Term.Name: coOccurs
Term.Definition: B coOccurs if and only if B starts at the same time as C starts and B ends at the same time as C ends.

Term.Name: contiguous
Term.Definition: A1, A2, Åc An contiguous if and only if they are temporally disjoint and connected.

Term.Name: sequential
Term.Definition: A1, A2, Åc An sequential if and only if they are temporally disjoint and not necessarily connected.

Term.Name: coBegin
Term.Definition: A1, A2, Åc An coBegin if and only if they start at the same time.

Term.Name: coEnd
Term.Definition: A1, A2, Åc An coEnd if and only if they end at the same time.

Term.Name: parallel
Term.Definition: A1, A2, Åc An parallel if and only if the intersection of A1, A2, Åc An has one non-empty interior.

Term.Name: overlapping
Term.Definition: A1, A2, Åc An overlapping if and only if the union of A1, A2, Åc An is connected and each Ai intersects at least one other Aj with non-empty interior.
